recipes.creditText: A Pretty Life in the Suburbs
recipes.sourceName: A Pretty Life in the Suburbs

extendedIngredients.name: artichoke hearts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup sliced drained canned artichoke hearts

extendedIngredients.name: caesar dressing
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ cup Kraft Creamy Caesar Dressing

extendedIngredients.name: refrigerated pizza dough
extendedIngredients.originalString: 375 g (1/2 of 750-g pkg.) refrigerated pizza dough

extendedIngredients.name: roasted red pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup roasted red pepper strips

recipes.title: Cheesy Grilled Chicken Flatbread

winePairing.pairingText: Chicken works really well with Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. One wine you could try is CalNaturale Chardonnay Lodi. It has 4.1 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 11 dollars.

productMatches.title: CalNaturale Chardonnay Lodi
productMatches.description: Complexity and intensity define this Chardonnay. The nose is full of citrus, green apple and pear with floral overtones. The flavors are rich on entry with lively fruit in the mid palate and a long fruity, warm finish.

recipes.instructions: Preheat your oven to 450ºF.Roll out the dough into 12x10-inch rectangle on lightly floured surface. Transfer to baking sheet sprayed with cooking spray.Spread dough with the caesar dressing, top it with the chicken, peppers and artichokes.Bake for 10 minutes.Then top with the shredded mozzarella and parmesan cheeses.Bake 8 to 10 minutes, or until the mozzarella is melted and the edge of crust is golden brown. Sprinkle with basil.

steps.step: Roll out the dough into 12x10-inch rectangle on lightly floured surface.
Transfer to baking sheet sprayed with cooking spray.
Spread dough with the caesar dressing, top it with the chicken, peppers and artichokes.
Bake for 10 minutes.Then top with the shredded mozzarella and parmesan cheeses.
Bake 8 to 10 minutes, or until the mozzarella is melted and the edge of crust is golden brown. Sprinkle with basil.
